means: （通常有专用装备的）潜水员( diver的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Coastguards had given up all hope of finding the two divers alive.
sentence.Network_cn: 海岸警卫队对两位潜水员生还已完全不抱希望。

sentence.Network_en: They wanted to get certified as divers.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们想拿到潜水员资格证。

sentence.Network_en: Two divers work together while a standby diver remains on the surface.
sentence.Network_cn: 两名潜水员协同工作,同时有一名候补潜水员留在水面上.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin diversus 'diverse', from divertere 'turn in separate ways' (see divert)

entry.def: A diver is a person who swims under water using special breathing equipment.

example.ex: Police divers have recovered the body of a sixteen year old boy.
example.tran: 警方潜水员已经找到了一名16岁男孩的尸体。
